meanings.definition: The flesh of a cow, bull, or ox, used as food.
meanings.sent1: I grilled some beef for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served delicious beef dishes.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cow bring a suitcase to the beef party? Because it was a luggage beef!
meanings.sent4: Her words had the beef of truth, cutting through the lies.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of sizzling beef filled the kitchen.

meanings.sent1: She had a beef with her noisy neighbors.
meanings.sent2: His beef about the service was valid.
meanings.sent3: Why did the hamburger file a police report? It had a beef with the buns!
meanings.sent4: The beef about the late delivery was heard by the manager.
meanings.sent5: The customer's beef was resolved with a refund.

meanings.definition: To add strength or power to something.
meanings.sent1: He tried to beef up his muscles by lifting weights.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to beef up their defense for the championship game.
meanings.sent3: Why did the computer go to the gym? To beef up its processing power!
meanings.sent4: She beefed up her resume with new skills.
meanings.sent5: The company beefed up security after the break-in.
